meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>inside</kanji> <kanji>side</kanji> is the <vocabulary>inside</vocabulary>. A little redundant but makes a lot of sense.
readingMnemonic: The readings are the kun'yomi readings. With 側 you've already learned it. With 内 you've also already learned the reading. Combine them together and you have うちがわ. In case you've forgotten, here's a mnemonic to help you remember that pesky うち portion. What is it that's drawn you inside? "<reading>Oo, chee</reading>se!" (うち) Cheese has drawn you inside. You're so excited that you exclaim, "Oo, cheese!"
